::: {.highlight-card}
**Focus:** Developing and applying mathematical models to evaluate intervention strategies and support evidence-based public health decision-making.
:::

![](../images/placeholder_policy.jpg){.featured-image fig-align="center" width="100%"}

## COVID-19 Vaccination Strategies {.section-header}

::: {.project-card}
### Scenario Modelling in the Netherlands

During the COVID-19 pandemic, I led scenario modelling efforts at RIVM (the Dutch National Institute for Public Health and the Environment) to anticipate the impact of vaccination strategies. We developed a deterministic age-structured compartmental model (**vacamole**) to compare different vaccination scenarios with respect to disease outcomes.

::: {.key-points}
::: {.key-point}
Infections
:::
::: {.key-point}
Hospitalisations
:::
::: {.key-point}

:::
::: {.key-point}
Deaths
:::
:::

Key analyses included evaluating the impact of extending vaccination to adolescents and children, comparing different vaccine rollout strategies, and assessing the timing and targeting of booster campaigns.
:::

::: {.project-card}
### European Scenario Modelling Hub

I contributed to the [**European COVID-19 Scenario Modelling Hub**](https://covid19scenariohub.eu/), a collaborative initiative that brought together modelling teams across Europe to provide ensemble projections for policy planning.

This work demonstrated the value of multi-model approaches for capturing uncertainty in epidemic projections and informed public health planning across multiple countries.
:::

## Beyond Vaccination {.section-header}

::: {.project-card}
### Intervention Analysis

My policy modelling work extends beyond vaccination to evaluating non-pharmaceutical interventions and their timing:

- **Optimal timing** of intervention implementation
- **Trade-offs** between intervention stringency and duration
- **Regional coordination** of public health measures
- **Resource allocation** during outbreak response
:::
